8 import rostest

10 #definition of class for unittest
11 class TalkerTestCase(unittest.TestCase):
12 
13 #wait for installation unit test to finish
14  sleep(4)
15 
16  print("\n\n\n***composiv_talker unit test started!***\n")
17 #we first set the okay condition to False to prevent false positive results
18  talker_ok = False
19 
20 #if the the node works properly and callback function is called,
21 # this method sets the okay condition to True
22  def callback(self, data):
23  self.talker_ok = True
24 
25 #given that this rospy is running, this method checks if there's an
26 # upcoming message in topic "chatter" which the talker node publishes to
27 # and then calls the callback function for required indication
28 # if there is no messages in the topic, the method keeps listening for
29 # 5 seconds and then terminates.
30  def test_if_talker_publishes(self):
31  rospy.init_node('test_talker')
32  rospy.Subscriber('/chatter', String, self.callback)
33 
34  counter = 0
35  while not rospy.is_shutdown() and counter < 5 and (not self.talker_ok):
36  sleep(1)
37  counter += 1
38 
39  self.assertTrue(self.talker_ok)
40 
41 
42 #rostest wrapper is required since this test is meant to be a ROS node launched via rostest
43 if __name__ == '__main__':
44  rostest.rosrun('composiv_tryouts', 'test_talker', TalkerTestCase)
